page.title: 03The Primary School Chailey
page.content: St Peters Church of England Primary School has 126 pupils aged 4-11. There are 6 teachers and the school has five classes. There are three prefabricated classrooms and the old school building which was built in 1854. There is also a canteen. The school field has a large climbing frame and is surrounded by woods in which the children can play. There is a Friends of the School Association which raises Â£1000 a year for buying school equipment. They hold auctions sales bazaars, and dances to raise the money. Each year the children go to St Peters Church to give their Harvest gifts and to hold a Harvest service. Afterwards all the old people in the Village come to the School for tea served and cooked by the teachers and children. The other main events are sports clay with strawberry teas,
